actions.committee: House Committee on Banking, Currency and Housing
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Banking, Currency and Housing.

official_title: A bill to amend the Truth-in-Lending Act to require that statements under open-end credit plans be mailed in time to permit payment prior to the imposition of finance charges.

summary.text: Requires that, under the Truth in Lending Act, a finance charge may not be imposed under an open end credit plan for any period unless a statement of the outstanding balance upon which the finance charge for that period is based is mailed at least twenty-one days prior to the date by which payment must be made in order to avoid imposition of that finance charge. (Adds 15 U.S.C. 1637(d))

titles.title: A bill to amend the Truth-in-Lending Act to require that statements under open-end credit plans be mailed in time to permit payment prior to the imposition of finance charges.
